ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: plant development, circadian rhythm, epigenetics/GMO, plant defense

A thorough understanding of plant development, how plants interact with the environment & other organisms, plants' circadian clocks (this was one of the coolest parts), plant genetics, epigenetics, disease defense, new technologies in the field & applications in agriculture
I also learned how to write review papers (what they call news & views) summarizing the findings of a specific paper. And some presentation skills in presenting the article for discussion + the final presentation
plant molecular bio concepts, reading molecular bio papers
You learn a lot about plant biology specifically but you also get to learn about the importance of plant bio to the world. It was super interesting and I learned a lot!

This class is a fabulous overview of the state of plant molecular biology! I learned more about how plants work and what science is currently studying while also developing my paper reading and presentation skills.

I learned so much about plant molecular biology, and the variety of papers from a range of different of different fields and topics helped me better understand different techniques and applications of this field of study.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Passionate professors, easy to schedule 1 on 1

strenghts: very chill, super interesting, not that much work, great teachers, learned a lot

weaknesses: had no idea what my grade was in this course the entire time. assignments wouldn't be graded for months. a little unorganized when it came to actually publishing the papers we needed to read. the final project was fun but it was annoying that a few people chose a super boring topic for the entire class. I would prefer more of a science fair vibe where, in small groups, people could present on whatever they wanted. and why do we need to submit FOUR news & views? they get quite boring after a while. I'd honestly shift the format to be MORE lecture based, less discussion based / going over papers. Although reading the cutting edge papers is interesting and should definitely stay as part of the course, the professors have so much experience and so much knowledge, I just want to hear about what they do and absorb as much as I can from them.

I liked that each professor taught what they are passionate about and research. I felt like the discussion part of the class was more stressful that necessary. It was jarring to have the professor in the back with a print out of faces from canvas marking every time you speak. I wish it felt less cold and calculated and more effort was put into creating an atmosphere where everyone wants to contribute, instead of feeling judged.
The organization of the class was great!
awesome professors, awesome course content

I love this class! The content is really cool and approachable, and the professors are all clearly experts and passionate about what they work on. The only improvement I can think of is having a little bit more communication between the professors. I know it must be hard to coordinate between four instructors, but it made the course feel a little disjointed at times.

The course was very engaging, and I really enjoyed the presentation+discussion format. The News and Views were great assignments that took a fiar amount of time but encouraged me to look more deeply into papers and understand them on multiple levels. I liked that the class met on Fridays for two hours. Practically no weaknesses.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: if you are interested in plants, I recommend
Yes!  This was a really fun course!

Yes!! If you're interested in learning about plants and how they work, this is an awesome class. It's very little work, the instructors are super knowledgeable, and the parts about circadian clocks is especially cool

I would definitely if they are in a plant molecular bio lab. If they are not, it is still great to learn about the material, but there is a bit of an outsider-insider feeling, especially with relationships with the professors.

I would highly recommend this course to anyone related in plant biology but also to any MCDB major looking for a good higher level elective. This is the best one out there!!! The professors are super great and engaged and it brought back fun into learning and got students from all backgrounds excited about the material.
I would highly recommend this course to another student. The professors of the course are all awesome and incredibly knowledgeable.
Absolutely! This is an amazing MCDB elective, especially for anyone passionate about plants and plant science.

Definitely! I think this is an amazing course and a gem in the MCDB curriculum. They should even offer it as more than one section to preserve the small-class format but enable more students to take it.
